name: NuGetInstaller
description: Installs or restores missing NuGet packages
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Path to solution or packages.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the Visual Studio solution file or NuGet packages.config

inputs.name: nugetConfigPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.config
inputs.helpMarkDown:
To use feeds within this account, check in a NuGet.config which lists those feeds as sources and select it here. This will allow the build system to authenticate to those feeds, assuming you have added the build identity as a reader or contributor to the feed.

Want to know more about feed permissions? [Learn more]( https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=733327).

inputs.name: restoreMode
inputs.label: Installation type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Restore will restore the packages a solution depends upon, and is generally what you want.

Install will install packages from a packages.config file. Use this option if you want to install a standalone tool package.

inputs.name: noCache
inputs.label: Disable local cache
inputs.helpMarkDown: Equivalent to the -NoCache NuGet.exe command line argument

inputs.name: nuGetRestoreArgs
inputs.label: NuGet arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to NuGet.exe restore or install. [More Information](https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#user-content-restore-command).

inputs.name: nuGetPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to NuGet.exe
